summary: There are thousands of abandoned hardrock mine features—e.g., pits or tunnels—on federal lands, which can pose risks to human health or wildlife. The Departments of the Interior and Agriculture spent about $109 million and $10 million, respectively, to clean up such contamination during FYs 2017-2021. Both agencies said they have more abandoned hardrock mines than funds to clean them up. But the agencies haven't clearly...
title: Abandoned Hardrock Mines: Land Management Agencies Should Improve Reporting of Total Cleanup Costs
